string-array.name: dhaka_district_itemtext
string-array.item:
Lalbagh Fort is the most popular and renowned fort and a great signature of art by Mughal Empire in Bangladesh. It is also known as Fort Aurangabad. It is located in Lalbagh of old Dhaka, hence named so. It is situated by the bank of the river Buriganga in a rich red soil.

 Entry fees of Lalbagh Fort :


• Local Tourists: 20 TK
 • SAARC Country Tourists: 100 TK
 • OMer Foreigners: 200 TK


Visiting hours of Lalbagh Fort :


Summer Season (April - September)

• Friday: 10.00 AM -12.30 PM
 • Saturday: 10.00 - 01.00 PM
 • Sunday:Weekly Holiday
 • Monday. 0230 PM - 06.00 PM
 . weednesDay:01.30 PM - 06.00 PM
The Sat Gambuj Mosque is stands in a romantic setting on a buttressed 15-foot-high bank overlooking an extensive flood plain
The university was established in 1970 by the Jahangirnagar Muslim University Ordinance of the government of Pakistan.
